snippet: Congress is busily preparing to reverse Mr. Obama’s anticipated veto of a bill that would allow families of those killed in the Sept. 11 attacks to sue Saudi Arabia for damages....
abstract: Carl Hulse On Washington column notes Pres Obama is about receive stinging rebuke of override in connection with his anticipated veto of bill allowing families of Sept 11 victims to sue Saudi Arabia for damages; notes White House officials say they do not see potential override, which would be a first for Obama, as repudiation of president or blot on his legacy.
lead_paragraph: Congress is busily preparing to reverse Mr. Obama’s anticipated veto of a bill that would allow families of those killed in the Sept. 11 attacks to sue Saudi Arabia for damages.

headline.print_headline: Obama Is on the Cusp of a Rebuke He Has Long Avoided: A Veto Override
headline.main: Obama Is on the Cusp of a Rebuke He Has Long Avoided: A Veto Override
